Articles.Content:
Hi there guys,

Imagine delivering a rover or landing on Duna, is it possible to set a thrusters to start about 50 meters before landing? Automatically that is...

I imagine you could rig something up using RemoteTech's flight computer, or a similar addon.. But may I ask why you would want to automatically start thrusting at 50m? I would think it would be very hard to ensure your automatic firing is at the right time, and thrust % for a safe landing without some input from yourself regardless.
kOS, if you're good with small programs.
Smart Parts can activate a stage or action group based on altitude.
You could also try Landertron, which is designed precisely for this problem

Thank you guys

Mech. Jeb.

You could also try Landertron, which is designed precisely for this problem

FYI, there's currently a Landertron bug that causes bad stuff to happen when you try to use it to land a vehicle horizontally. I hope to have a fix out soonish.

Tbh I haven't used Landertron, it's just on my future list for if I pluck up courage to use RT2 I wonder if this bug could be fixed by mounting a probe core such that it'd be vertical when the rover's horizontal, and controlling from there...
